title: Contributing to rstudiothemes
text: outlines propose change rstudiothemes. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to rstudiothemes
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to rstudiothemes
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to rstudiothemes
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("dieghernan/rstudiothemes", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to rstudiothemes
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to rstudiothemes
text: contributing guide adapted tidyverse contributing guide available https://tidyverse.tidyverse.org/CONTRIBUTING.html.

what: Convert a Visual Studio Code theme into a TextMate theme — convert_vs_to_tm_theme
title: Convert a Visual Studio Code theme into a TextMate theme — convert_vs_to_tm_theme
text: Read *.json file representing Visual Studio Code theme write equivalent TextMate theme (*.tmTheme).

title: Convert a Visual Studio Code theme into a TextMate theme — convert_vs_to_tm_theme
code: convert_vs_to_tm_theme(   path,   out_tm = tempfile(fileext = ".tmTheme"),   name = NULL,   author = NULL )

title: Convert a Visual Studio Code theme into a TextMate theme — convert_vs_to_tm_theme
text: path Path Visual Studio Code theme, *.json format. out_tm Path resulting file written. default temporal file (tempfile()). name Optional. name theme. provided name VS Code theme path used. author Optional. author theme. provided name VS Code theme path used.

title: Convert a Visual Studio Code theme into a TextMate theme — convert_vs_to_tm_theme
text: function called side effects. return character path file out_tm.

title: Convert a Visual Studio Code theme into a TextMate theme — convert_vs_to_tm_theme
code: vstheme <- system.file("ext/test-simple-color-theme.json",   package = "rstudiothemes" ) path <- convert_vs_to_tm_theme(vstheme) #> ! VSCode theme "Skeletor Syntax" does not have author, use the `author` argument. #> ℹ Using `author = "rstudiothemes R package"`.  path #> [1] "C:\\Users\\RUNNER~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpaMxEaB\\file2180559b3cf5.tmTheme"  readLines(path) |>   head(50) |>   cat(sep = "\n") #> <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> #> <plist version="1.0"> #>   <dict> #>     <key>name</key> #>     <string>Skeletor Syntax</string> #>     <key>author</key> #>     <string>rstudiothemes R package</string> #>     <key>colorSpaceName</key> #>     <string>sRGB</string> #>     <key>semanticClass</key> #>     <string>theme.dark.skeletor_syntax</string> #>     <key>comment</key> #>     <string>Generated with rstudiothemes R package</string> #>     <key>uuid</key> #>     <string>65316264-3362-4031-a334-396431643737</string> #>     <key>settings</key> #>     <array> #>       <dict> #>         <key>settings</key> #>         <dict> #>           <key>background</key> #>           <string>#2B2836</string> #>           <key>foreground</key> #>           <string>#DCE7FD</string> #>           <key>selection</key> #>           <string>#55535E</string> #>           <key>lineHighlight</key> #>           <string>#55535E</string> #>           <key>caret</key> #>           <string>#BD93F9</string> #>           <key>invisibles</key> #>           <string>#363340</string> #>           <key>gutterForeground</key> #>           <string>#655E7F</string> #>         </dict> #>       </dict> #>       <dict> #>         <key>name</key> #>         <string>comment</string> #>         <key>scope</key> #>         <string>comment</string> #>         <key>settings</key> #>         <dict> #>           <key>foreground</key> #>           <string>#655E7F</string> #>         </dict> #>       </dict> #>       <dict> #>         <key>name</key> #>         <string>doctype</string>

title: Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
text: Generate Universally Unique Identifiers (UUID) version 4 (pseudo-random numbers).

title: Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
text: Heavily based unreleased version ids::uuid().

title: Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
text: hint Optional. Character (object coercible .character()) may used random seed.

title: Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
text: character() representing valid UUID can validated uuid::UUIDvalidate().

title: Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
text: helper function assign UUID identifying versions generated themes.

title: Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
text: Davis KR, Peabody B, Leach P (2024). "Universally Unique IDentifiers (UUIDs)." RFC 9562. doi:10.17487/RFC9562 , https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc9562.

title: Random UUIDs generation — generate_uuid
code: # Random generate_uuid() #> [1] "e4656e2e-9ec3-45c8-8404-fe174e4c81bd"  generate_uuid() #> [1] "36aa3d2a-04d4-4bbc-a145-febe03efa1a2"  # Persistent with hint param  hint <- "something as seed"  generate_uuid(hint) #> [1] "736f6d65-7468-496e-a720-617320736565"  generate_uuid(hint) #> [1] "736f6d65-7468-496e-a720-617320736565"

what: Read and parse a TextMate theme — read_tm_theme
title: Read and parse a TextMate theme — read_tm_theme
text: Read *.tmTheme file (really *.xml file) representing TextMate Sublime Text theme.

title: Read and parse a TextMate theme — read_tm_theme
Read and parse a TextMate theme — read_tm_theme
text: path Path TextMate theme, *.tmTheme format.

title: Read and parse a TextMate theme — read_tm_theme
text: tibble.

title: Read and parse a TextMate theme — read_tm_theme
code: the_theme <- system.file("ext/test-color-theme.json",   package = "rstudiothemes" ) |>   # Generate the theme   convert_vs_to_tm_theme()  # Check readLines(the_theme) |>   head(10) |>   cat(sep = "\n") #> <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> #> <plist version="1.0"> #>   <dict> #>     <key>name</key> #>     <string>Tokyo Night</string> #>     <key>author</key> #>     <string>Enkia, rstudiothemes R package</string> #>     <key>colorSpaceName</key> #>     <string>sRGB</string> #>     <key>semanticClass</key>  read_tm_theme(the_theme) #> # A tibble: 372 × 7 #>    section   name              scope value       foreground background fontStyle #>    <chr>     <chr>             <chr> <chr>       <chr>      <lgl>      <chr>     #>  1 highlevel name              NA    Tokyo Night NA         NA         NA        #>  2 highlevel author            NA    Enkia, rst… NA         NA         NA        #>  3 highlevel colorSpaceName    NA    sRGB        NA         NA         NA        #>  4 highlevel semanticClass     NA    theme.dark… NA         NA         NA        #>  5 highlevel comment           NA    Generated … NA         NA         NA        #>  6 highlevel uuid              NA    39323639-3… NA         NA         NA        #>  7 colors    background        NA    NA          #1A1B26    NA         NA        #>  8 colors    foreground        NA    NA          #A9B1D6    NA         NA        #>  9 colors    selection         NA    NA          #515C7E4D  NA         NA        #> 10 colors    inactiveSelection NA    NA          #515C7E25  NA         NA        #> # ℹ 362 more rows
